basics.name: Loïc Colin
basics.label: Senior Front-End Engineer / Full Stack Engineer

work.name: Zenjob
work.position: Senior Front-End Engineer / Full Stack Engineer
work.summary: Zenjob, based in Berlin, Germany, matches over 20,000 talents with 12,000 part-time jobs from over 1,000 companies every month. The platform empowers the workforce of tomorrow, enabling part-time jobbers to decide when, where, and how to work with just a few clicks.
highlights: Led an initiaitve with 4 engineers to increase automation from 75% to 98% by developing and implementing a fully automated order management system. Resulted in streamlined processing, reduced manual intervention, and resource optimization.
Refactored the B2B application's front-end authentication system by migrating from Redux to React Context for improved robustness and maintainability.
Developed a user-friendly bulk order process that accelerated processing, benefiting customers with large orders and enhancing efficiency, 70% of orders are now created through this UI.
Migrated end-to-end tests from TestCafe & Cypress to Playwright, reducing flaky failures by 30% and speeding up the Jenkins pipeline by 25%. Enhanced testing reliability and efficiency.

work.name: eLamp
work.summary: Involved in eLamp’s early stages as a student, we started from the founders’ couch. Despite challenges, we built a successful product, leading to eLamp’s acquisition by a larger group in 2023.
highlights: Shaped a startup’s tech direction from inception, building a robust front-end tech stack with TypeScript, React, and GraphQL.
Developed complex user interfaces and data visualization tools with React and D3JS.
Created features for a user-friendly product, focusing on aesthetically pleasing designs and functional animations.
Ensured software quality through rigorous testing methodologies, maintaining high standards for our products and reducing bugs by 30%.
Improved site load time by 15% by implementing advanced caching techniques.

courses: Gained in-depth understanding of computer science principles and software design.
Learned to apply creative problem-solving in technological contexts.
Acquired skills in project management, including agile and scrum methodologies.
Applied theoretical knowledge to practical projects using specific programming languages or technologies.
Collaborated with diverse teams on different projects.
Basics of computer science and software engineering.
